conclusion: P-V diagram shows a Stirling cycle with states A, B, C, and D; Processes A→B and C→D are isothermal; Determine if velocity distribution changes during D→A
A→B is isothermal expansion; B→C appears to be isochoric cooling; C→D is isothermal compression; D→A appears to be isochoric heating
D→A shows increasing pressure at constant volume, indicating an isochoric heating process
Maxwell-Boltzmann velocity distribution depends on temperature; Probability density function is given by f(v) = 4π(m/2πkT)^(3/2) v^2 e^(-mv^2/2kT)
During isochoric process in ideal gas, if pressure increases, temperature must increase
Since P increases from D to A at constant V, temperature must increase

When temperature increases, the peak of Maxwell-Boltzmann distribution shifts to higher velocities, distribution becomes broader, average molecular velocity increases, distribution curve changes shape
Velocity distribution curve changes during D→A process due to isochoric heating and temperature increase
